1{-# LANGUAGE ViewPatterns #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Encode and decode integers.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Text.Integer
7  ( -- * Decoder
8    tDec, tInt, tInteger,
9    tHex, tHexInt, tHexInteger,
10    tCustomInteger, tCountInteger,
11    stringDec, stringInt, stringInteger,
12    stringHex, stringHexInt, stringHexInteger,
13    stringCustomInteger, stringCountInteger,
14
15    -- * Encoder
16    intLowerHexString, intUpperHexString,
17    integralCustomString, integralCountString,
18    digitsLength,
19  ) where
20
21import qualified Data.Char                              as Ch
22import qualified Data.IntMap.Strict                     as Mi
23import qualified Data.Map.Strict                        as Ms
24import qualified Numeric                                as Num
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Text.Textual  as O
26
27
28-- ----------------------  Decoder
29
30textMaybe :: (O.Textual t) => (t -> [(a, t)]) -> t -> Maybe a
31textMaybe f s = case f s of
32                  [(x, s')] | O.tIsEmpty s' -> Just x
33                  _  -> Nothing
34
35-- | Decode decimal integer.
36tDec :: (O.Textual t, Eq n, Num n) => t -> Maybe n
37tDec (O.tCut -> Just (sign, t))
38    | sign == '+' = tDecDigits t
39    | sign == '-' = negate <$> tDecDigits t
40tDec t = tDecDigits t
41
42tDecDigits :: (O.Textual t, Eq n, Num n) => t -> Maybe n
43tDecDigits t = textMaybe Num.readDec $ O.tString t
44
45-- | Decode decimal integer.
46{-# DEPRECATED stringDec "Use 'tDec' instead." #-}
47stringDec :: (O.Textual t, Eq n, Num n) => t -> Maybe n
48stringDec = tDec
49
50-- | Decode decimal integer as 'Int'.
51--
52--   >>> tInt <$> ["12", "+12", "-12"]
53--   [Just 12,Just 12,Just (-12)]
54--
55--   >>> tInt "12.3"
56--   Nothing
57--
58--   >>> tInt "12345678901234567890"
59--   Just (-6101065172474983726)
60--
61tInt :: (O.Textual t) => t -> Maybe Int
62tInt = stringDec
63
64-- | Decode decimal integer as 'Int'.
65{-# DEPRECATED stringInt "Use 'tInt' instead." #-}
66stringInt :: (O.Textual t, Eq n, Num n) => t -> Maybe n
67stringInt = tDec
68
69-- | Decode decimal integer as 'Integer'.
70--
71--   >>> tInteger "12345678901234567890"
72--   Just 12345678901234567890
73--
74tInteger :: (O.Textual t) => t -> Maybe Integer
75tInteger = tDec
76
77-- | Decode decimal integer as 'Integer'.
78{-# DEPRECATED stringInteger "Use 'tInteger' instead." #-}
79stringInteger :: (O.Textual t) => t -> Maybe Integer
80stringInteger = tDec
81
82-- | Decode hexadecimal digits.
83tHex :: (O.Textual t, Eq n, Num n) => t -> Maybe n
84tHex = textMaybe Num.readHex . O.tString
85
86-- | Decode hexadecimal digits.
87{-# DEPRECATED stringHex "Use 'tHex' instead." #-}
88stringHex :: (O.Textual t, Eq n, Num n) => t -> Maybe n
89stringHex = tHex
90
91-- | Decode hexadecimal digits as 'Int'.
92--
93--   >>> tHexInt "0F"
94--   Just 15
95--
96tHexInt :: (O.Textual t) => t -> Maybe Int
97tHexInt = stringHex
98
99-- | Decode hexadecimal digits as 'Int'.
100{-# DEPRECATED stringHexInt "Use 'tHexInt' instead." #-}
101stringHexInt :: (O.Textual t) => t -> Maybe Int
102stringHexInt = stringHex
103
104-- | Decode hexadecimal digits as 'Integer'.
105--
106--   >>> tHexInteger "0F"
107--   Just 15
108--
109tHexInteger :: (O.Textual t) => t -> Maybe Integer
110tHexInteger = tHex
111
112-- | Decode hexadecimal digits as 'Integer'.
113{-# DEPRECATED stringHexInteger "Use 'tHexInteger' instead." #-}
114stringHexInteger :: (O.Textual t) => t -> Maybe Integer
115stringHexInteger = tHex
116
117-- | Decode custom digits to integer.
118--
119--   >>> tCustomInteger "01234567" "144"
120--   Just 100
121--
122tCustomInteger :: (O.Textual t) => String -> t -> Maybe Integer
123tCustomInteger = tIntegerFrom 0
124
125-- | Decode custom digits to integer.
126{-# DEPRECATED stringCustomInteger "Use 'tCustomInteger' instead." #-}
127stringCustomInteger :: (O.Textual t) => String -> t -> Maybe Integer
128stringCustomInteger = tIntegerFrom 0
129
130-- | Decode counting digits to integer.
131--
132--   >>> tCountInteger ['A'..'Z'] <$> ["", "A", "B", "Y", "Z", "AA", "AZ", "BA", "CV", "ALL", "KOSHU"]
133--   [Just 0, Just 1, Just 2, Just 25, Just 26, Just 27, Just 52, Just 53, Just 100, Just 1000, Just 5303449]
134--
135tCountInteger :: (O.Textual t) => String -> t -> Maybe Integer
136tCountInteger = tIntegerFrom 1
137
138-- | Decode counting digits to integer.
139{-# DEPRECATED stringCountInteger "Use 'tCountInteger' instead." #-}
140stringCountInteger :: (O.Textual t) => String -> t -> Maybe Integer
141stringCountInteger = tIntegerFrom 1
142
143tIntegerFrom :: (O.Textual t) => Integer -> String -> t -> Maybe Integer
144tIntegerFrom from digits = loop 0 where
145    m = Ms.fromList $ zip digits [from ..]
146    b = toInteger $ length digits
147
148    loop n (O.tCut -> Just (d, ds)) =
149        case Ms.lookup d m of
150          Nothing -> Nothing
151          Just i  -> loop (b * n + i) ds
152    loop n _ = Just n
153
154
155-- ----------------------  Encoder
156
157integralLowerHexString :: (Integral n, Show n, O.Textual t) => n -> t
158integralLowerHexString n = O.stringT $ Num.showHex n O.tEmpty
159
160integralUpperHexString :: (Integral n, Show n, O.Textual t) => n -> t
161integralUpperHexString = O.tMap Ch.toUpper . integralLowerHexString
162
163-- | Encode integer to hexadecimal string.
164--
165--   >>> intHexString 15
166--   "f"
167--
168intLowerHexString :: (O.Textual t) => Int -> t
169intLowerHexString = integralLowerHexString
170
171-- | Encode integer to hexadecimal string.
172--
173--   >>> intUpperHexString 15
174--   "F"
175--
176intUpperHexString :: (O.Textual t) => Int -> t
177intUpperHexString = integralUpperHexString
178
179-- | Encode integer to custome-digit string.
180--
181--   >>> integralCustomString "OI" <$> [0..8 :: Int]
182--   ["O", "I", "IO", "II", "IOO", "IOI", "IIO", "III", "IOOO"]
183--
184integralCustomString :: (Integral n) => String -> n -> String
185integralCustomString digits = loop "" . abs where
186    dig  = Mi.fromList $ zip [0..] digits
187    base = integralLength digits
188    loop s 0 | null s    = [dig Mi.! 0]
189             | otherwise = s
190    loop s n = case quotRem n base of
191                 (n', i) -> loop (dig ! i : s) n'
192
193-- | Encode integer to counting string.
194--
195--   >>> intReckonString ['A'..'Z'] <$> [0, 1, 2, 25, 26, 27, 52, 53, 100, 1000, 5303449]
196--   ["", "A", "B", "Y", "Z", "AA", "AZ", "BA", "CV", "ALL", "KOSHU"]
197--
198integralCountString :: (Integral n) => String -> n -> String
199integralCountString digits = loop "" . abs where
200    dig       = Mi.fromList $ zip [0..] $ '_' : digits
201    base      = integralLength digits
202    loop s 0  = s
203    loop s n  = case countDiv n base of
204                  (n', m) -> loop (dig ! m : s) n'
205
206-- | Integral version
207(!) :: (Integral n) => Mi.IntMap a -> n -> a
208(!) m n = m Mi.! fromIntegral n
209
210-- | Integral version of 'length'.
211--
212--   >>> integralLength "abc" :: Integer
213--   3
214--
215integralLength :: (Integral n) => [a] -> n
216integralLength [] = 0
217integralLength (_ : xs) = 1 + integralLength xs
218
219-- | Reckoning division.
220--
221--  >>> (`countDiv` 3) <$> [1 .. 10 :: Int]
222--  [(0,1),(0,2),(0,3),(1,1),(1,2),(1,3),(2,1),(2,2),(2,3),(3,1)]
223--
224countDiv :: (Integral n) => n -> n -> (n, n)
225countDiv x y =
226    case quotRem x y of
227      (q, r) | r == 0    -> (q - 1, y)
228             | otherwise -> (q, r)
229
230-- | Length of digits of integer.
231--
232--   >>> digitsLength 10 12000
233--   5
234--
235--   >>> digitsLength 10 (-500)
236--   4
237--
238--   >>> digitsLength 2 15
239--   4
240--
241digitsLength :: Int -> Int -> Int
242digitsLength b n0
243    | n0 >  0   = loop n0
244    | n0 <  0   = 1 + loop (abs n0)
245    | otherwise = 1
246    where
247      loop 0 = 0
248      loop n = 1 + loop (n `div` b)
249
